newsitem.title: ITALY: World's largest passenger ship launched in Italy.
newsitem.headline: World's largest passenger ship launched in Italy.

text.p: The world's largest passenger cruise ship, the Grand Princess, was launched Thursday at shipbuilder Fincantieri's Monfalcone shipyard in northeast Italy.

The 109,000 gross ton vessel will be floated to a nearby outfitting pier for interior completion on Friday before handover in spring 1998, when it will become the flagship of the Princess Cruises fleet. Princess Cruises is owned by Britian's Peninsular & Oriental Steamship Navigation Co.
The $400 million, 285 meter (935 feet) long Grand Princess will have 1,296 cabins with a maximum capacity of 3,300 passengers and a crew of 1,100.
The Grand Princess will feature a virtual reality centre, five pools, a glass-walled night club suspended 150 feet above the stern, and a nine-hole putting green and computerized golf centre.
